properties.description:
Stage 1 and 2
We start with two lanes temporarily diverted (traffic pushed into the eastern curb) while crossing the north
bound lane of Marshland Rd with work in centre of road between the two crossings (1. at 61b Marshland Rd
when we trench out of the pump station to the centre of the Rd and 2. at the Marshland Rd/Hammersley
Ave intersection when we head from the manhole in the centre of Marshalnd Rd west into Hammersley
Ave).
Stage 3
Heading west into Hammersley Ave we will revert to two lanes temporarily diverted (traffic pushed into the
eastern curb) which will reduce to a lane closure (west bound lane of Hammersley Ave) with one way
system east bound to Marshland Rd once clear of Marshland Rd.
Stage 4
When we get to Hammersley/Sabina Intersection we will need to set up a Road Closure on Sabina to create
the link into the main line in Hammersley coming north from Sabina, one way east bound to Marshland Rd
will continue.
Once this link is established and the road from Sabina to Marshland is trafficable we will swap the one
way around to head west on Hammersley. From here we trench to Hammersley/Cherryburton
Intersection.
Stage 5
A Road Closure will be put in for Cherryburton main line Installation.
Stage 6
Following this the mainline will continue west along Hammersley to a manhole 10m east of Quinns Rd.

Works will include digout of old and replace with new.

Lateral investigation – potholing the location of the lateral at the boundary and CCTV from the gully trap for condition assessment.
Installation of a new vacuum sewer system in parallel to keeping the existing system in operation.  This involves installation of collection Chambers – in council land, vent stacks on private boundaries and the install of new vacuum mains. Final hook up to the new system will happen only when the vacuum pump station is built and commissioned.  The pump station is due for completion in August 2014 
and is being done by other parties outside this contract.
This system requires the installation of collector chambers in most cases on public property which have two to three properties connecting in to it.  We also have to install a vent stack at the property boundary by the collection chamber.  Installation of new pipework and associated fittings, install of a telemetry system at the same time as the vacuum mains.
Due to the ground conditions and high water table this area went through a rigorous design process comparing it to Pressure WW 
and Vacuum WW. Road Reconstruction will then take place through out the whole catchment using the same setups
